value: having a funeral the thoughts of the
thoughts of more or less my kids had
growing up not knowing who I was was the
hardest thing for me to deal with you
know I was thinking when I was going to
do because they told Wendy they told all
of us you know estimate two to five
years she had left to live
Wendy and Steve Moore were living out
their dreams they both had exciting
careers Steve as a sheriff's deputy and
Wendy is a 911 emergency medical
technician their young family was
growing as they celebrated the birth of
their youngest son Zachary what started
off as a strange weakness in when his
legs was eventually diagnosed as Meo
trophic lateral sclerosis better known
as Lou Gehrig's disease
it destroys motor nerves and leaves the
body in a state of paralysis no one
survives this deadly disease Wendy and
Steve's dreams for the future quickly
turned into a nightmare when I read the
literature on it
and you know you you suffocate to death
I mean that's how you die it's a
horrible horrible death and I didn't
wanna have to go through that was my
active life you know that I thought you
know I I take care of other people
that's my job so you know it's not
somebody's got to take care of me it's
part of like a living funeral I mean
every time we tried to put it aside
somebody else either called stop by and
we can never just put it behind us
Wendy's parents remember their shock
after hearing the diagnosis well I knew
exactly what ALS was when they gave us
that diagnosis however I was numb to
what they were saying I've got a cousin
whose wife died of ALS and it was
horrific she just said mom I don't know
if we're gonna have if I went to see
Jake go to school if I'm going to see
Zak you graduate you know those were all
things that were in her mind and
naturally she'd share with us and that
would bring on more tears you know
Wendy's aunt Jan knew the only hope for
the family was the power of God's Word
she suggested a class on healing why
called my brother and I told him I said
you hit you have to go to these class
I said Wendy will be healed it's here at
Dayspring ministries that Wendy and her
family learned the healing promises of
the Bible
it gave them the strength to press on I
learned things like you know God's Word
is life to those who find it health all
their flesh so it starts to make you
feel like you know what this is the
stuff that's gonna make me live you know
I through all the other things away
through the trash that wasn't what I
needed to hear they had told me what
they told me now I was taking a
different approach so all the pamphlets
all the information on Lou Gehrig threw
it away you tossed it tossed it and in
their place Bible verses everywhere we
had scriptures post all over the our
house and that Ida had to take my debt
with my daily dose of medication that
scripture Wendy's mother also knew they
were going to need the support of other
believers to fight this battle
I called 700 club I called several of
ministries I we had relatives all over
the United States and and sent emails to
all over the United States and asked
them to pray with us and believe that
when he would be healed and what did you
think when you would hear these reports
from the doctors that yes you still had
Lou Gehrig's it's still progressing or
you're maintaining what was going
through your mind you know man always
tell me no we can't be moved by what
they say you know work it you can listen
to what they say but you can't be moved
by that you have to be moved with the
word of God says the Word of God says by
His stripes you were healed Wendy and
her family pressed on they tried to live
a normal life and believed that God was
going to heal her Wendy even decided to
go back to her job as a 911 I began to
see improvements because I wasn't
falling as often my muscles would twitch
you know I'd have muscle twitches and it
they weren't twitching quite as often
anymore but really what I noticed the
most is the the falling I wasn't
tripping as much as what I normally did
so that's when I really started to
notice some physical you know
manifestation Wendy's doctors at the
University of Michigan couldn't
understand why her condition wasn't
getting worse so they asked her to go
through more testing we walked in the
room and Wendy was sobbing she was
literally sobbing her head was
in her hands and she was sobbing and I
asked her I said what's wrong and she
looked up and was crying and she says I
no longer have ALS and that's exactly
what we have been praying for and what
did the doctors say
what was their explanation um they said
that that there was no nerve death they
say they had seen some nerve damage so
there was evidence that there was
something that had gone on the final
doctor's report declared Wendy more free
of ALS or Lou Gehrig's disease it's just
it's just an awesome overwhelming
feeling to have been told that you know
something you're gonna die and now for
the doctors to say this is gone you know
and yet I knew in my spirit the whole
time that's what Beth that would be the
outcome
Wendy's aunt knows that God listens and
answers the prayers of believers I just
see how much he loved us what he died on
the cross and he took our sicknesses and
our diseases and I'm just so thankful
that he he is God today Wendy and Steve
are enjoying the life they thought
they'd never have they are once again
dreaming of a future filled with the
hope that Jesus Christ gives them now
it's a family again I mean it's not just
me with the kids it's all of us every
day it has to be wake I wake up and I
thank God for today
I'm almost thankful that I've gone
through what I've gone through because I
may have not I may not be where I meant
today being able to tell you and being
able to tell the whole world that God's
healing power is still for today you
know he's the same yesterday today and
forever
